channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumping of dug up pavement by road workers outside my house., 20th November
item.description:
I have a concrete lorry coming on Monday 24 November 2025 to run concrete to my garden from outside my house and if this rubbish isn't cleared by then the concrete lorry will block the road. I need the rubbish removed urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priory Avenue, Poverest, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping Maiden Lane/Mayplace Ave, Crayford, 20th November
item.description:
Flytipping Maiden Lane/Mayplace Ave, Crayford - I am asking for urgent attention for Maiden Lane and Mayplace Avenue where streets are heavily polluted by rubbish and fly tipping!!! Streets are covered in polystyrene panels dumped in the middle of the road and now scattered all over the streets 100 m each direction!!! Place looks like a GHETTO thanks to social housing polluting our area !!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maiden Lane, Barnes Cray, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned grey vauxhall corsa, 20th November
item.description:
Just because this vehicle is taxed doesn't mean you shouldn't move it. What you should be attempting to locate the owner, contact them and give them a deadline to move it before it is removed by Bromley Council at there cost. It is a hazard, it has been there for more than 3 weeks and causes unnecessary traffic given the inconsiderate location of the car. The duty is always on the councils to remove and a different significant amount of time is deemed a valid reason on its own regardless of the tax situation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goddard Road, Elmers End, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water Leak (seemingly from outlet marked 'Gas'), 20th November
item.description:
Water covering the whole of the pavement from 36/38 High Street all the way down to the kebab shop. Very dangerous as the temperature drops and the water freezes causing 'ice rink' conditions for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Widmore, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 bikes in disrepair locked to bike rack, 20th November
item.description:
There have been 2 bikes locked to the railing at the Butterfield Park end of Prince George Road for months now. Both have parts missing and are clearly unusable. I have checked on the street WhatsApp group and no one has claimed ownership.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Prince George Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep Pothole, 20th November
item.description:
This is a new pothole, the road is narrow so it can be hard to avoid when two cars are driving on it. I have now got a flat tire due to this and I can imagine that this will happen to many other people. This is a hazard at night as its dark and the road isn't lit but also in the mornings when the sun is low and its hard to see. This needs to be fixed ASAP
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Lane, North Cray, Foots Cray, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet
